answers.answer: I don't know anything about hypoglycemia, except it has to do with how he breaks down sugars, which can relate to diabetes.  You need to get a neurologist to visit with him, and order an MRI or CAT scan of his brain, to see if he had a bleed or if he has brain damage from a fall or a growth.  I mean, they have to rule out anything organic going on in his brain.  Those would be my thoughts.  I'm sorry this has happened, and I think you deserve a rather more thorough explanation of what is going on with him.

question: My brother walked into ER ~ one month ago, spoke his history and concern.  He was confused as to where he was at home and inapproriate, mixing cat food and mayonaise and had lost control of his bowels.He was admitted to a psychiatric unit.  He was transferred to a stepdown CCU for episode of hypoglycemia and irregular heart rate.  Promptly stabilized, he was transferred to a medical unit and was ignored for "treatment."  He progressively lost his speech and can only cry or laugh.He is now in a nursing home; cannot feed, bathe himself and is incontinent.  He is aware of what is said to him; he laughs appropriate but mostly cries.  His pupils are dilated medium size.They say this is from hypogylcemia.  I cannot believe it and I want to help him and don't know how.Please help.
title: What Happened to my brother
